alert.note: Alert for Hood (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 25 at 10:31PM CDT until October 26 at 3:30AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Erath, Hood, Parker and Somervell counties. * WHEN...Until 230 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas have already experienced minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts near 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Worth, Weatherford, Stephenville, Mineral Wells, Azle, Granbury, Dublin, Briar, Pecan Plantation, Willow Park, Reno, Aledo, Springtown, Glen Rose, Brock, Hudson Oaks, Western Lake, Annetta, Poolville and Lipan.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
